roleset.name: to capture, obtain, taking hold of

example.name: transitive with adverbials
example.text: Likewise , in the U.S. , Nissan has grabbed 5.2 % of the car market so far this year , up from 4.5 % a year ago .

example.name: simply transitive
example.text: But such convolutions would still block [the networks]-1 from [*-1]grabbing a big chunk of the riches of syndication .
example.arg: a big chunk of the riches of syndication

example.name: Light Verb
example.text: Meaning that its economy and military are both 10 times stronger than everyone else s - no I do n't , as I 've pointed out in my previous post , there 'll China will inevitably want to become the regional power of Asia , it-1 'll want *PRO*-1 to do some land - grabbing of its own -LRB- Taiwan for example -RRB- which will lead to its demise .
example.arg: which will lead to its demise

roleset.note:
GRAB-V NOTES: Based on WSJ. Member of VNcls steal-10.5, obtain-13.5.2, hold-15.1. (from grab.01-v)
GRABBING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, grab.01. Corresponds to VNcls steal-10.5-1, obtain-13.5.2, hold-15.1-1. (from grabbing.01-n)
